title: Texas A&M Tightens Rules on Talking About Race and Gender in Classes
summary: The university system will ban advocacy of “race or gender ideology, or topics related to sexual orientation or gender identity” without approval.

title: Indiana Professor Removed From Class Over White Supremacy Lesson
summary: The professor will no longer be able to teach a class on diversity after she showed students a diagram that included the “Make America Great Again” slogan as an example of white supremacy.

title: Some TSA Workers to Get $10,000 Bonus Checks for Shutdown Work
summary: Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, began handing out $10,000 checks to T.S.A. workers who “went above and beyond” during the shutdown, after the president recommended similar bonuses for some air traffic controllers.

title: After Trump Split, Epstein Said He Could ‘Take Him Down’
summary: Jeffrey Epstein cast himself as a Trump insider and wanted to leverage potentially damaging information about the president and his business dealings, according to emails with associates.

title: Epstein’s Emails About Trump
summary: Our investigative reporter Steve Eder provides context about Jeffrey Epstein’s relationship with President Donald Trump based on information from over 20,000 pages of documents from Epstein’s estate released by the House Oversight Committee on Wednesday.

title: What Epstein’s Emails Claim About Trump’s Knowledge of His Conduct
summary: The House Oversight Committee on Wednesday released more than 20,000 pages of documents from Jeffrey Epstein’s estate. Times reporters provide context on key emails.

title: What’s Behind the Coming House Vote on Releasing the Epstein Files
summary: Proponents of fuller transparency used an arcane rule to prod their leaders to act. When it became clear they had succeeded, the speaker agreed to hold a vote.

title: Former Prince Andrew and Another Prominent Briton Come Up in the Epstein Emails
summary: Newly released files from Jeffrey Epstein include correspondence with Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor and Peter Mandelson, the former British ambassador to Washington.

title: How a 17-Year-Old Girl Became Enmeshed in the Matt Gaetz Scandal
summary: A 17-year-old with a homeless parent wanted money for braces and ended up having sex for money with powerful men. She wants the public to have a fuller understanding of how she was victimized.

title: Trump Officials Prepare Tariff Exemptions, Seeking to Lower Food Prices
summary: If the proposal goes into effect, it would be the latest rollback of one of President Trump’s key economic policies over concerns about affordability.

title: SNAP Benefits Are Resuming as Government Reopens After Shutdown
summary: Several states have restarted food stamp payments, but millions of Americans are still awaiting the November deposits that the Trump administration resisted paying out in full.

title: SNAP’s Problems Started Long Before the Shutdown
summary: The government shutdown caused a panic among recipients, but the monthly budgeting issues go back 50 years and may get worse.

title: U.S. Officials Raise Concerns About Saudi Arabia’s Bid for F-35 Jets
summary: A Pentagon intelligence report says China could try to acquire advanced F-35 technology in Saudi Arabia if the Trump administration sells jets to the kingdom.

title: Why Can’t We Fix Penn Station?
summary: The biggest thing holding Penn Station back from a much-needed rehaul is what’s on top of it: Madison Square Garden.

title: Family of Fisherman Killed in U.S. Military Strike Says It Wants Justice
summary: Colombia was a top U.S. ally in Latin America until the Trump administration began deadly strikes in international waters. Now, one family wants justice.

title: BBC Apologizes to Trump Over Film Edit but Declines to Pay Compensation
summary: The BBC said it would not rebroadcast a misleadingly edited documentary but added, “We strongly disagree there is a basis for a defamation claim.”

title: At 97, the Bard of Albany Still Spins Tales of Gangsters and Politicians
summary: William Kennedy raised money for the food pantry at his old church by reading from “Legs,” the gangster novel he began his celebrated Albany cycle with half a century ago.

title: Katie Wilson, a Political Newcomer, Is Elected Mayor in Seattle
summary: Ms. Wilson, a self-described socialist, joined the race after Mayor Bruce Harrell opposed taxing high-income residents to finance construction of new housing.

title: Seattle Elects a Left-Wing Mayor With a Light Résumé but Mamdani Appeal
summary: Katie Wilson, who narrowly defeated the incumbent, Bruce Harrell, emerged from the city’s left-wing activist class and brings with her little experience in governing.

title: Blue Origin Lands Booster After Rocket Launch and Matches SpaceX’s Feat
summary: The lower half of the New Glenn rocket set down on a platform in the Atlantic Ocean after lifting a small NASA Mars mission to space.

title: Infant Formula Company Tied to Botulism Outbreak Had Known Problems
summary: A Pennsylvania plant run by the company, ByHeart, was shut down this year after inspectors found mold, a leaking roof and more than 2,500 dead insects in a food production area.

title: Far Right’s Fixation on Jan. 6 Pipe Bomb Suspect Reaches F.B.I.’s Top Ranks
summary: For all his bluster, the F.B.I.’s deputy director Dan Bongino played a central role in stoking expectations that the bureau would quickly find the suspects who planted pipe bombs.

title: Mamdani and Hochul Discuss Their Challenges: Trump and Child Care
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect of New York City, and Gov. Kathy Hochul met to talk about how to prepare for threats from President Trump.

title: Hochul Approved Permits That Could Help Clients of Her Husband’s Firm
summary: Opponents of a natural gas pipeline approved by Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York noted that the project would benefit a client of the prominent law firm where her husband works.

title: Wifredo Lam: Artist-Poet of Tropical Dreams and Sorrows
summary: The great Cuban modernist, whose politics and Afro-Asian roots shaped his paintings and inspired generations of artists, gets a revelatory survey at MoMA.

title: An Alternative to Christian Nationalism
summary: Once you put people into categorical boxes, you are inviting them to see history as a zero-sum conflict between this group and that one.

title: One of the Founders’ Worst Fears Has Been Realized
summary: Trump has a favorite power.

title: The Government Reopened
summary: Also, Ukraine is facing a dilemma in Pokrovsk. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.

title: Jim Avila, Former ABC News Correspondent, Dies at 70
summary: He spent almost two decades at the network, covering a wide range of court cases and the White House. He was also at the center of a defamation lawsuit over “pink slime.”

title: Justice Dept. Joins Lawsuit to Challenge California’s New Redistricting Maps
summary: The agency intervened in a lawsuit brought by the California Republican Party seeking to throw out a map, approved last week by the state’s voters, that would redraw House districts to favor Democrats.

title: Carney Accelerates Economic Plan for Canada to Rely Less on U.S. Amid Trade War
summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney fast-tracked mines and other natural resource projects to the dismay of some Indigenous groups and many environmentalists.
